newsitem.title: USA: NL Industries suspends div on bleak forecast.
newsitem.headline: NL Industries suspends div on bleak forecast.

text.p: NL Industries Inc said Wednesday that a continuing decline in prices for titanium dioxide pigments is likely to result in a fourth quarter loss, prompting it to suspend the regular quarterly dividend.
The company said the outlook for titanium dioxide pigments pricing remains bleak.
Average selling prices for the pigments for this year's third quarter were 15 percent below prices in the same period in the prior year, and 6 percent lower than in this year's second quarter.

The company said it expects average prices in the fourth quarter to be "somewhat below" the third quarter average. Although prices have dropped, demand for titanium dioxide pigments has continued to grow, it said.
The company had set a dividend of $0.10 per share for shareholders of record on September 16, payable September 30.
In this year's third quarter, the company reported a net loss of $4.2 million, or $0.08 per share, compared with a net profit of $17.4 million, or $0.34 per share, in the prior year's third quarter.
